intro: Sideroxylon egense, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a slow-growing, evergreen tree native to tropical Africa, characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant typically reaches heights of up to 20 meters and has a straight, cylindrical trunk with a smooth, greyish-brown bark. Its flowers are small and clustered in yellowish-green cyathia, and it produces woody, elongated fruits containing seeds. Due to its durability and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in traditional construction.
